articles.headline: Fed Is Torn on Tipping Point for Action
articles.snippet: An account of the June policy meeting shows concern over slow growth was weighed against uncertainty about the consequences of new intervention.
articles.abstract: An account of the June policy meeting shows concern over slow growth was weighed against uncertainty about the consequences of new intervention.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Federal Reserve officials agreed at a meeting in June that unemployment would remain elevated for another five to six years, but most did not regard that as reason enough to expand the Fed’s efforts to stimulate growth, according to an official account published on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Conservatives Push Romney to Deliver Counterpunch
articles.snippet: Mitt Romney’s restraint over the last two weeks has opened a round of second-guessing about his insistent focus on the economy as Democrats have turned attention to other topics.
articles.abstract: Mitt Romney’s restraint over the last two weeks has opened a round of second-guessing about his insistent focus on the economy as Democrats have turned attention to other topics.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Mitt Romney and his team of advisers built a reputation during the Republican primaries as tough street fighters skilled in the tactics of political warfare. They quietly took pride in tearing apart Newt Gingrich, Rick Santorum and the rest of their rivals.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Ashley Parker

articles.headline: In Kansas, Stronger Mix of Ethanol
articles.snippet: Ethanol makers want to offer a blend of fuel that is 15 percent ethanol rather than 10 percent. At a Phillips 66 station in Lawrence, Kan., E15 is catching on.
articles.abstract: Ethanol makers want to offer a blend of fuel that is 15 percent ethanol rather than 10 percent. At a Phillips 66 station in Lawrence, Kan., E15 is catching on.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAWRENCE, Kan. — Intended as an additive to gasoline, ethanol in modern times was meant to stretch America’s fuel supplies, much as a cook uses chicken stock to increase the volume of a soup. By federal mandate, ethanol makes up about 10 percent of most fuel that motorists buy at the pump.

articles.headline: Fear of Year-End Fiscal Stalemate May Be Having Effect Now
articles.snippet: Economists say uncertainty over tax increases and spending cuts set to take effect at the end of 2012 could be cutting into economic growth already.
articles.abstract: Economists say uncertainty over tax increases and spending cuts set to take effect at the end of 2012 could be cutting into economic growth already.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — With the economy having slowed in recent weeks, business leaders and policy makers are growing concerned that the tax increases and government spending cuts set to take effect at year’s end have already begun to cause companies to hold back on hiring and investments.

articles.headline: Not in the Convention, but Still Part of Comic-Con
articles.snippet: A planned expansion of the San Diego Convention Center is leaving limited space for exhibitors. So companies have started to think outside the box. Or outside the convention center.
articles.abstract: A planned expansion of the San Diego Convention Center is leaving limited space for exhibitors. So companies have started to think outside the box. Or outside the convention center.

articles.headline: For a Soaring Political Career, Uncertain Turns
articles.snippet: Representative Jesse L. Jackson Jr. has suffered blows to his image, including an absence his office explained by saying he was in treatment for “a mood disorder.”
articles.abstract: Representative Jesse L. Jackson Jr. has suffered blows to his image, including an absence his office explained by saying he was in treatment for “a mood disorder.”
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — A few years ago, the political career of Representative Jesse L. Jackson Jr. was soaring.
